thread.title: Razer's concept laptop has three 17-inch 4K displays. Your laptop does not. Your laptop sucks.
thread.title_full: Razer's concept laptop has three 17-inch 4K displays. Your laptop does not. Your laptop sucks.

author: Derek Kessler
title: Razer's concept laptop has three 17-inch 4K displays. Your laptop does not. Your laptop sucks.
text:
Razer's 2017 design ethos: well, why not?
The Razer Blade Pro has a great 17.3-inch 4K display, but what if it had three 17.3-inch 4K displays? That's the idea behind Project Valerie, a bonkers concept design unveiled at CES 2017 from the mad scientists at Razer.
The base of Project Valerie is the current top-end Razer Blade Pro, for all intents and purposes. It has the same 6th-generation Intel Core i7 Skylake processor, the same high-powered NVIDIA GTX 1080 GPU, the same custom vapor chamber heat management system, and the same ultra-low-profile mechanical keyboard with Chroma RGB lighting that we fell in love with. All of this is wrapped in a black aluminum unibody chassis â€” it just happens to have three 17.3-inch 4K displays attached.
